Community Hub
TERA
From En Masse Entertainment, TERA is at the forefront of a new breed of MMO. With True Action Combat - aim, dodge, and time your attacks for intense and rewarding tactical combat. Add the deep social experience of a MMO to best-in-class action combat mechanics for a unique blend of both genres. Play now for free!
User reviews: Very Positive (6,520 reviews) - 83% of the 6,520 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: May 5, 2015

Recent updates View all (13)

October 16

"The Lost Isle" Update and Halloween Events Available Now!

TERA ’s latest update, The Lost Isle, is available now as a free download! Featuring an improved character creation experience, a new stream-lined starter island, a new rewards system for returning players, and a treat-filled Halloween event, the Lost Isle has a little something for TERA players of every level!



The Lost Isle introduces a number of improvements to the new player experience, making NOW the perfect time to jump into TERA if you haven’t done so yet! First up, character creation has been overhauled to provide you more information when choosing from TERA ’s seven unique races and ten distinct character classes. You can match races and classes to view their combined appearance, compare the stats of different classes against each other, and even catch a peek of each class’s skills in a short overview video. In addition, the new starter zone, Stepstone Isle, provides a stream-lined experience to ensure you get trained up quickly before diving into TERA ’s trademark true action combat.

For seasoned level 58-65 veterans on hiatus from TERA for one month of more, the new Returning Heroes system ensures suitable buffs and gear await you upon your return, allowing you to jump right back into dungeons and PvP without missing a beat.



Halloween has descended upon TERA with the return of Kyra’s Pop-Up Potion Shack. Kyra has decked out the shack with spooky decorations and a whole new inventory of Halloween-themed prizes, including mounts, pets, costumes, and accessories! She’s also brewed up new ways for players to earn catalysts in-game, including community-wide headhunts targeting TERA ’s spookiest monsters! The event runs until November 5 and new potion shack prizes will be added weekly throughout the event, so check back often.

Visit our Kyra’s Pop-Up Potion Shack news post for more information about this event.



Finally, now that “The Lost Isle” update is available in TERA , you might be thinking about starting a new character. Why not outfit that character with everything you need to make the most of your game—especially when our most popular DLC packs are 50 percent off?

Starting Friday, October 16 at 10 a.m. PDT, you can pick up any or all of the following DLC packs from the TERA Store and Steam at a 50 percent discount:

Starter Pack
Explorer's Pack
Accessorize Pack
Totes the Portal Pet Bank
Steam-Powered Pack

View all the discounted DLC packs here .

These pack discounts only last until Friday, October 23 at 9:59 a.m. PDT, so don’t wait too long!

20 comments Read more

September 15

Fistful of Fall Festivals

With summer almost over, we thought you might like even more reasons to play TERA . Specifically, our fall festival lineup, including Bamarama, Rootstock, and Pond Faire.

From now until maintenance on Tuesday, October 6, TERA 's trio of festive festivals are back for your gaming enjoyment.



Bamarama
At specific times during the day, the BAMs come out to play! Talk to Lein (just west of the Rootstock fairground, at the entrance to the arena), and place wagers on which of two BAMs will win in a head-to-head match up. Start by purchasing golden tickets from Teena, Tayana, or Linu (the Bamarama bookies), then place your bets with them. If your BAM wins, you'll get a piece of the purse, via parcel post: more golden tickets, which you can sell back to the bookies when you're ready to cash out! (You can also get golden tickets by completing Rootstock daily quests.)

Golden Ticket events occur every ten minutes, until ten minutes before the hour, when Bamarama hosts a special Diamond Ticket event! Diamond Tickets up the betting amount, so even if you can't make it to the other matches, be sure to be on hand at ten 'til!

Rootstock
Just outside the Bamarama arena, the Freeholds' annual winter harvest festival is going on! The return of Rootstock brings back such events as Kick-Bale, the Pigling Rodeo, Rootstock quests, food, drink, and a whole festival worth of daily event quests!

Pond Faire
Players of level 18 and higher can join in the festivities as baba (baby) tuwangis turn seven years old. Play Drum Away and Hide & Seek, participate in daily quests, and just soak in the heady atmosphere of the Tuwangi Mire!

TERA Goes Berserk with Wild New Update



Go Berserk is the wild new update to TERA that adds berserker tanking skills, new top-tier gear, two new dungeons, a new battleground, and more!

With five new level 65 skills, Berserkers can now fulfill the coveted dungeon-tank role, and the Go Berserk update provides plenty of extra dungeons, including: Timescape, a new 5-player dungeon; Akeron’s Inferno, a new 10-player raid dungeon; a revamped Vault of Kaprima; and the return of Shattered Fleet.

All of this, plus even more content, is available now as part of a free update! Check out the Go Berserk web page for more information.

Major Update: New Gunner Class



TERA 's latest update introduces a stylish new playable characters class, the gunner!

Gunners are fast-moving, high-DPS ranged combatants who never stop to ask questions—they’re too busy shooting first! With run-and-gun tactics and cool new weapons, TERA 's True Action Combat has never been so satisfying!

To learn more about the gunner class, visit her personal website , or watch our new class overview video to see her in action!

The gunner class is available now as part of a free update!

READ MORE

About This Game

TERA is at the forefront of a new breed of MMO. With True Action Combat - aim, dodge, and time your attacks for intense and rewarding tactical combat. Add the deep social experience of a MMO to best-in-class action combat mechanics for a unique blend of both genres. Play now for free!


Experience an action MMO that goes beyond "point and click!" In TERA , it's your skill, position, timing, and aim that determine the outcome of combat—not how quickly you cycle through targets with the Tab key. If you prefer to lie down on your couch while playing games (we do!), you'll be happy to hear that TERA also offers controller support.


Team up with friends to take down Big Ass Monsters or put your combat skills to the test against other players in one of the many PvP battlegrounds TERA offers.


Customize your choice of seven character races and nine classes with unique battle styles. Fight thousands of monsters throughout a variety of landscapes, and embark on thousands of quests in a game world rich in history and lore.


In a truly free-to-play experience. TERA imposes no artificial cap on classes, zones, or what you can do, or how good you can be - all of the content in the game can be experienced without paying a single penny. To support the continued development of TERA , we offer account services and cosmetic items - costumes, accessories, weapon skins, mounts, and more. We heard players on Steam really like hats...


Whether you fight as part of a guild or join an alliance, being part of TERA's vibrant community means that there is always someone to share your journey with.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP (32-bit only), Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8
    • Processor: AMD Athlon64 3200+ or INTEL Pentium 4 3.2ghz
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: ATI Radeon X1600T or nVidia GeForce 7600GT
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Hard Drive: 40 GB available space
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7, Windows 8 (Latest Service Packs)
    • Processor: AMD Athlon64 X2 6000+ or INTEL Core 2 Duo E6750
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 3870 or nVidia GeForce 8800GT
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Hard Drive: 40 GB available space

1 person found this review funny
Ashe
176 products in account
2 reviews
Recommended
455.0 hrs on record
Posted: July 19
Ah, where to begin with this game. I've been playing it for at least 2-3 weeks now, and as someone who wasted their life away on WoW for 4+ years straight, and who is very iffy and skeptical of "F2P" games, my experience has been enjoyable. Going to review the main parts of the game that I feel make it stand out from other F2P games.

Graphics and overall design - The game is visually stunning. No other way to describe it. The graphics, the scenery, the character design are all gorgeous as hell. The character creation/customization is also quite amazing and if you're like me you'll find yourself engrossed in making your characters for long periods of time. Granted, a lot of the armor designs are over-the-top and sexualized, but that goes for both the female and male armor. The male Castanic's armor designs are a fine example of that. But hey, everyone likes eyecandy right? And they even have some for the ladies!

Combat - The combat is super fun and engaging, as well as satisfying. You have to actually aim your abilities and a lot of the time it's while you're on the move. It can be a little weird to adjust to, at least it was for me (Again, I came from WoW), but it's very easy to pick up. Even as a tank, you have to watch the mobs your fighting and time your blocks properly. It's a lot different from other MMO's, where most of the time it's just target + hit your skill button. You get a lot of abilities you can use, but you can link them together via combos, where you can do your rotations in order via using your spacebar. Makes it a little easier if you get overwhelmed by all the stuff you have at your disposal.

F2P and Elite Status - The big part for me. TERA is a F2P game with an item shop and optional "Elite" status (AKA the subscription plan). When I started playing the game, and even later on, I never felt like I needed to buy anything in the item shop to progress. Everything in the shop are cosmetic items and items for convenience. Certainly not "pay-to-win". This is what attracts me to the game the most. Granted, I did eventually start up a subscription, but that was because I enjoy the game just that much. You don't have any real advantages as an elite member from what I have seen, just convenience and a neat mount. Everything in the item shop can be bought through in-game currency via the player marketplace, including 30 and 60-day vouchers for elite status. So technically, you don't even need to pay actual money for stuff in the item shop or for elite status if you decided to go that route. Overall the F2P system on this game is very fair and will not make your characters stronger and won't make you feel like you /have/ to buy things in the item shop in order to get anywhere. Item shops are usually the make-or-break for a lot of F2P games, and TERA has perfected it.

I would definitely recommend this game if you want super engaging combat, beautiful graphics and character design, and a F2P system that doesn't make you feel forced to buy anything from the item shop. The leveling can be a bit of a grind after a point (It's a Korean MMO, after all), and sometimes the community can be a bit weird (Particularly about goats and Elins), but if you can tolerate those things then by all means give it a shot. You won't regret it!

Rez
122 products in account
5 reviews
Recommended
246.8 hrs on record
Posted: May 23
TERA is:
NOT Pay2Win
NOT stiff or clunky
Fun
FREE
Easy to get into
Balanced (at least as far as PVE goes)

But really, The game's good. Unlike other MMOs like say, WoW where you can pump stats and become practically untouchable as you stand still while the game dictates whether you dodge or not. You actually have to evade attacks yourself. The stats only control your damage output and some damage mitigation as well as resistance to knockdown (your worst enemy for any class). You want an XP boost? either get it from the game store OR the in game vendor that takes federation bills, which you get 5 of each day.

A few things about certain classes:

BERSERKER- If you're making a Berserker, fighting BAMs will be the most annoying thing to deal with at early levels, since you'll spend most of the fight blocking, though it depends how fast and mobile the particular BAM is, but yeah, its better to team up with someone that can distract the BAM so you can get the maximum damage out (Berserkers have the highest single hit burst damage in the game, properly specced out you can take a solid chunk out of a boss's health bar, compared to the steady bits going away when the entire group's beating on it. Also, if all goes right, bring someone to tears in PVP). I say this because zerkers lack real mobility like the other classes have, so you'll notice it takes longer to down a BAM solo, compared to other classes.

WARRIOR- If you want a challenge, try learning to be an evasive tank on Warrior. Their offense is excellent, I'd even say easy, but trying to tank when you know the boss/room full of minions can blow you up since you're wearing leather, plus dishing out damage is a nice balancing act.

MYSTIC- send pet, use damage spells, pet dies, put enemy to sleep, resummon pet and repeat. Personally I only find this class fun in dungeons since you can't use the tanking pet in there (unless you're soloing a group dungeon), it screws up the Tank's mojo and also pulls extra aggro when you're trying to be sneaky.

GUNNER- I'd have to say this is the easiest class in the game. You get dodge on a 5 second timer that has a chance to not trigger the cooldown timer, plus a rocket jump for extra mobility, a grenade that stuns, a bot that heals you and a proximity turret. Believe me, this is the most newbie friendly class in the game. and one of the few classes that can take advantage of "more damage from behind" bonuses when standing right in front of the enemy.....When you see their moveset, you'll see what I'm talking about.

REAPER- The stunlock king. You get 3 stuns, a counter attack, an attack that spaces you quite a ways away from the target AND the ability to cheat death. So unless you're going after some really mobile and hard hitting BAMs you can go from fight to fight with little to no breaks in between.

*haven't tried archer, priest or Lancer and retired my sorcerer early to make the mystic

I can't stress it enough, if you like MMOs and action games, you'll love this. They don't keep the good stuff behind a pay wall, it's completely optional unless you like to customize or collect mounts/pets.
